message:
> otherwise the next line runs before PredictStockMarketAsync() completes

That's not the reason.

The reason behind using Task.Run here is to prevent blocking the UI thread. This is the "complex case", where PredictStockMarketAsync does both I/O *and* intense CPU processing. It's because of the CPU processing that the UI thread wants to use Task.Run.

> Would you correct it?

I elide async/await in trivial cases. More info here: [http://blog.stephencleary.com/2016/12/eliding-async-await.html](http://blog.stephencleary.com/2016/12/eliding-async-await.html)
